segments.summary: GitHub repo view, starting Claude Code
Welcome screen, typing read ~/favicon-todo.txt
Todo file displayed - 6 bugs, 2 features, 1 doc gap
User reviews list, selects fix high severity bugs first
Claude starts planning, reading source files
Searching codebase for color parsing code
Understanding issues, planning implementation
Adding named colors (maroon, aqua, silver, gold)
Implementing transparent support and color matching
Unicode code point parsing implementation
Building project with cargo build --release
Testing Bug #6 (U+2764) - FIXED
Testing Bug #1 (named colors) - FIXED
Running cargo clippy - all three bugs fixed
Cargo fmt, preparing git commit
Git commit: Add named colors, transparent, hex code points
Git push origin main
Starting Bug #5 - wrench symbol fix
Adding wrench, tool, hammer to symbols.txt
Bug #3 PNG filename fix - default to favicon.png
All tests pass, no clippy errors - checkpoint
Demo checklist - Demo 1-4 status check
Demo 5-7 verification - all working
User: you have not shown me anything using display
Creating animated GIFs for demos
Demo 6 animated GIF - spinning gear and star
User asks to see demos, xdg-open display commands
Displaying wrench demo image
this one is broken - demo4-red-on-black display issue
Displaying heart-hex demo
GIF too slow, checking frame-delay argument
Creating faster gear GIF with frame-delay 10
Still too slow, trying frame-delay 1
Not moving at all, checking code for frame_delay
Found issue: frame delay is in centiseconds
Fixing with proper centisecond values
No visible movement still - investigating
Browser opens showing Favicon Demo page
Demo page with Custom Colors, Rotation sections
Animated GIF section visible in browser
User: how does that look? Response: much better
Displaying remaining demo items for verification
Displaying wrench, heart-hex, star-transparent
Updating demo HTML with spinning wrench GIF
Adding spinning star to demo page
Browser refreshed showing animations
good - animations working correctly
Final status table - Bug #5 PASS, Bug #6 PASS
Feature #1 PASS, Feature #2 PARTIAL, Doc #1 PASS
8 of 9 items complete, updating help text
User: why cant foreground be transparent?
Checking rendering code for foreground transparency
Building and testing transparent foreground
Displaying demo-transparent-fg.png result
All 9 original items complete + bonus feature
Git commit for documentation updates
Adding favicon-todo.txt, final git push
Done - run full test suite to verify
